p: Supplementary studies into the metagenomic data set showed picobirnaviral sequences in the fecal material. Picobirnaviruses are non-enveloped double-stranded RNA viruses. They are bisegmented with segment one consisting of 2.3 to 2.6 kilobases and segment two of 1.5 to 1.9 kilobases [ 30]. Picobirnaviruses are often associated with cases of gastroenteritis or infections in the respiratory tract [ 31]. The role in diarrhea diseases in piglets is unclear, since picobirnaviruses were found in piglets with and without diarrhea [ 32]. The transmission is fecal-oral [ 33] and these viruses have so far been detected mainly in feces in various species [ 30, 33]. Impact and relevance of these findings remains to be clarified by future studies.
